metadata.title: CVE-2023-4054 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
When opening appref-ms files, Firefox did not warn the user that thesefiles may contain malicious code. *This bug only affects Firefox onWindows. Other operating systems are unaffected.* This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 116, Firefox ESR < 102.14, Firefox ESR < 115.1,Thunderbird < 102.14, and Thunderbird < 115.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:115.2.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs102 package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
